channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Covid: Fifth of England hospital admissions aged 18-34
item.description: The new NHS chief executive urges unvaccinated young adults to get jabbed, saying it is "so important".

item.title: Covid vaccine refuser died after terrible mistake, says partner
item.description: Leslie Lawrenson died and his partner became seriously ill with Covid after they refused vaccines.

item.title: Euro 2020 racist abuse - 11 people arrested
item.description: Hundreds of racist messages were reported following England's defeat and police inquiries continue.

item.title: London riots: Youth services cut in half since unrest
item.description: London's young people have missed out on Â£240m of investment over the last 10 years, figures show.

item.title: Rugby League World Cup 2021 postponed until 2022 following withdrawals
item.description: The Rugby League World Cup in England is postponed until 2022 following the withdrawal of defending champions Australia, and New Zealand.

item.title: Alex Yee: 'I didn't feel worthy to stand on the start line'
item.description: Alex Yee, 23, won two medals at the Olympics - but had self-worth issues when he first turned pro.

item.title: PPE: Gateshead NHS Trust first to make its own masks
item.description: The masks have four layers, one of which is anti-viral and proven to kill Covid, the trust says.

item.title: Man killed in tanker attack named as Adrian Underwood
item.description: Adrian Underwood died when the ship was struck by an explosive-laden drone off the coast of Oman.

item.title: Alta Fixsler: European court rejects appeal over Jewish girl's life support
item.description: Two-year-old Alta Fixsler's parents say withdrawing treatment is against their religious beliefs.

item.title: Covid jabs given to 100 seafarers in Cornwall
item.description: The vaccine is given to seafarers who are at sea for months, regardless of their nationality.

item.title: Rutland Osprey Project celebrates after 200th chick fledges
item.description: The Rutland Osprey Project reaches the milestone as it marks 25 years since it began.

item.title: What are the holiday rules for travel to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: The government has updated its red, amber and green lists of countries.

item.title: Why bonding over the Euros appeared to increase Covid cases in men
item.description: Psychologists say men need to be part of a group in order to vent their feelings and emotions.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Wolverhampton proud of Ben Whittaker
item.description: Friends and family in Wolverhampton couldn't be prouder of the silver medallist.

item.title: Covid: Wigan nurse's photos capture life in intensive care unit
item.description: Nurse Petro Bekker's photos of her team in the intensive care unit are to feature in an exhibition.

item.title: Wigan family rescue deer from drowning in canal
item.description: Chris and Denver Kendall, from Wigan, tied two dog leads together to pull the animal to safety.

item.title: Dog-snatching thief filmed by doorbell camera in Horndean
item.description: A 13-year-old boy was walking his border terrier Melchy when he was pushed out of the way.

item.title: Basketball: Chatham teenager gets scholarship to play for top US side
item.description: Tamara Fournillier-Onadeko, who plays at youth level in the GB squad, is heading to Chicago.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Liam Heath wins bronze, Galal Yafai shines and Dina Asher-Smith returns
item.description: Liam Heath wins a bronze medal for Great Britain in the men's kayak single 200m as Galal Yafai reaches the Olympic final in Tokyo.

item.title: England v India: Michael Vaughan says Dom Sibley & Dan Lawrence 'out of their depth'
item.description: England batters Dom Sibley and Dan Lawrence are "out of their depth" in Test cricket, says former captain Michael Vaughan.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Katarina Johnson-Thompson will "take time to process" Olympic withdrawal
item.description: Katarina Johnson-Thompson says she is "going to take some time to process" her withdrawal from the Olympic heptathlon due to a calf injury in a "heartbreaking" end to her Games.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Galal Yafai beats Saken Bibossinov to reach flyweight final
item.description: Great Britain's Galal Yafai reaches the Olympic flyweight final with a thrilling win over Saken Bibossinov of Kazakhstan.
